alert.note: Alert for North Snowy Range Foothills; Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 10 at 1:05PM MST until December 14 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches possible in North Snowy Range Foothills. 10 to 14 inches possible above 7500 feet. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...North Snowy Range Foothills, Sierra Madre Range and Snowy Range. * WHEN...From Monday morning through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact hikers, snowmobilers, hunters, and others recreating outdoors. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: North Snowy Range Foothills; Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range
